definitions.translation: 合伙；合作关系；伙伴关系
definitions.usage_note: 可数或不可数。指两人或多方之间的合作关系，可用于商业、政府、国际等语境。

sentences.en: The two companies formed a strategic partnership.
sentences.zh: 两家公司建立了战略合作伙伴关系。

sentences.en: Our partnership with the local university has been very successful.
sentences.zh: 我们与当地大学的合作非常成功。

sentences.en: She went into partnership with her brother to start the business.
sentences.zh: 她和哥哥合伙创办了这家公司。

sentences.en: The firm entered into partnership with a Japanese company.
sentences.zh: 该公司与一家日本公司建立了合伙关系。

collocations.translation: 公私合营；公私合作伙伴关系

sentences.en: The project was funded through a public-private partnership.
sentences.zh: 该项目通过公私合营方式获得资金。

alliance.diffs: alliance 多指政治或军事联盟；partnership 侧重商业或协作关系

sentences.en: The two countries formed a military alliance.

collaboration.diffs: collaboration 强调共同工作；partnership 强调正式、长期的伙伴关系

sentences.en: The collaboration between the two departments was fruitful.
sentences.zh: 两个部门之间的合作成果丰硕。

etymology.origin: 来自 partner（合伙人）+ -ship（名词后缀），意为“合伙人的身份或关系”。
etymology.history: partner 源自 part（部分），合伙人即“共同分有一部分的人”；-ship 表关系或状态。

partner.rule: partnership 去掉后缀 -ship 即得

sentences.en: They signed a partnership agreement last month.
sentences.zh: 他们上个月签署了合伙协议。

common_mistakes.correct: in partnership with one another / in partnership
common_mistakes.explain: partnership 本身已含“双方/多方”之意，in partnership with each other 略显冗余；可说 in partnership 或 in partnership with [具体对象]。

mnemonics.content: partner（合伙人）+ -ship（关系）→ 合伙人之间的关系 → 合伙；合作关系。
